R10.nl_constraint: Planes should never have less than half of their maximum fuel capacity

children.nl_constraint: Every aircraft should always maintain at least half of its maximum fuel capacity throughout the entire plan execution.

content.text:
<documents>
<pddl_domain>
;; Enrico Scala (enricos83@gmail.com) and Miquel Ramirez (miquel.ramirez@gmail.com)
(define (domain zenotravel)
        ;(:requirements :typing :fluents)
        (:types
                locatable city - object
                aircraft person - locatable
        )
        (:predicates
                (located ?x - locatable ?c - city)
                (in ?p - person ?a - aircraft)
        )
        (:functions
                (fuel ?a - aircraft)
                (distance ?c1 - city ?c2 - city)
                (slow-burn ?a - aircraft)
                (fast-burn ?a - aircraft)
                (capacity ?a - aircraft)
                (total-fuel-used)
                (onboard ?a - aircraft)
                (zoom-limit ?a - aircraft)

                (n_board ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_refuel ?a - aircraft)
        )

        (:action board
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?p ?c)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (located ?p ?c))
                        (in ?p ?a)
                        (increase (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_board ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action debark
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (in ?p ?a)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (in ?p ?a))
                        (located ?p ?c)
                        (decrease (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_debark ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action flyslow
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a))))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total-fuel-used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyslow ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action flyfast
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (<= (onboard ?a) (zoom-limit ?a)))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total-fuel-used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyfast ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action refuel
                :parameters (?a - aircraft)
                :precondition (and (> (capacity ?a) (fuel ?a))

                )
                :effect (and (assign (fuel ?a) (capacity ?a))
                        (increase (n_refuel ?a) 1))
        )

)
</pddl_domain>
<pddl_problem>
(define (problem ZTRAVEL-3-10)
(:domain zenotravel)
(:objects
	plane1 - aircraft
	plane2 - aircraft
	plane3 - aircraft
	person1 - person
	person2 - person
	person3 - person
	person4 - person
	person5 - person
	person6 - person
	person7 - person
	person8 - person
	person9 - person
	person10 - person
	city0 - city
	city1 - city
	city2 - city
	city3 - city
	city4 - city
	city5 - city
	)
(:init
	(located plane1 city4)
	(= (capacity plane1) 2326)
	(= (fuel plane1) 205)
	(= (slow-burn plane1) 1)
	(= (fast-burn plane1) 2)
	(= (onboard plane1) 0)
	(= (zoom-limit plane1) 10)
	(located plane2 city2)
	(= (capacity plane2) 12132)
	(= (fuel plane2) 1469)
	(= (slow-burn plane2) 4)
	(= (fast-burn plane2) 9)
	(= (onboard plane2) 0)
	(= (zoom-limit plane2) 9)
	(located plane3 city3)
	(= (capacity plane3) 5204)
	(= (fuel plane3) 1532)
	(= (slow-burn plane3) 2)
	(= (fast-burn plane3) 7)
	(= (onboard plane3) 0)
	(= (zoom-limit plane3) 8)
	(located person1 city1)
	(located person2 city2)
	(located person3 city1)
	(located person4 city4)
	(located person5 city5)
	(located person6 city1)
	(located person7 city0)
	(located person8 city2)
	(located person9 city1)
	(located person10 city5)
	(= (distance city0 city0) 0)
	(= (distance city0 city1) 619)
	(= (distance city0 city2) 565)
	(= (distance city0 city3) 886)
	(= (distance city0 city4) 596)
	(= (distance city0 city5) 766)
	(= (distance city1 city0) 619)
	(= (distance city1 city1) 0)
	(= (distance city1 city2) 561)
	(= (distance city1 city3) 756)
	(= (distance city1 city4) 760)
	(= (distance city1 city5) 980)
	(= (distance city2 city0) 565)
	(= (distance city2 city1) 561)
	(= (distance city2 city2) 0)
	(= (distance city2 city3) 657)
	(= (distance city2 city4) 702)
	(= (distance city2 city5) 639)
	(= (distance city3 city0) 886)
	(= (distance city3 city1) 756)
	(= (distance city3 city2) 657)
	(= (distance city3 city3) 0)
	(= (distance city3 city4) 546)
	(= (distance city3 city5) 510)
	(= (distance city4 city0) 596)
	(= (distance city4 city1) 760)
	(= (distance city4 city2) 702)
	(= (distance city4 city3) 546)
	(= (distance city4 city4) 0)
	(= (distance city4 city5) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city0) 766)
	(= (distance city5 city1) 980)
	(= (distance city5 city2) 639)
	(= (distance city5 city3) 510)
	(= (distance city5 city4) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city5) 0)
	(= (total-fuel-used) 0)
)
(:goal (and
	(located plane1 city4)
	(located person1 city4)
	(located person2 city5)
	(located person3 city4)
	(located person4 city0)
	(located person5 city2)
	(located person6 city3)
	(located person8 city0)
	(located person9 city3)
	(located person10 city4)
	))

(:metric minimize (total-fuel-used))





)
</pddl_problem>
</documents> 

<information>
The user will give as input a natural language constraint that must be translated into PDDL3.0. The translation will be used by a PDDL planner.
</information>

<instructions> 
- Translate the input constraint into correct PDDL3.0.
- The resulting PDDL3.0 constraint must capture the same meaning as the initial input constraint.
- Remember that PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based. They can only refer to existing precates and fluents, thus, not to actions.
- Be sure to include temporal logic like operators in your translation.
- Format your answer such as there is no preambule and such that the PDDL translation is between the tags <pddl> and </pddl>.
</instructions>

<user_input>
Every aircraft should always maintain at least half of its maximum fuel capacity throughout the entire plan execution.
</user_input>

The user wants me to translate the constraint "Every aircraft should always maintain at least half of its maximum fuel capacity throughout the entire plan execution" into PDDL3.0.

Let me analyze this constraint:
1. "Every aircraft" - this means for all aircraft objects
2. "should always maintain" - this means at all times during execution
3. "at least half of its maximum fuel capacity" - this means fuel(aircraft) >= capacity(aircraft)/2
4. "throughout the entire plan execution" - this reinforces the "always" temporal aspect

In PDDL3.0, I need to use temporal logic operators. The "always" constraint is typically expressed using the "always" operator.

Looking at the domain, I can see:
- There are aircraft objects of type "aircraft"
- There's a function (fuel ?a - aircraft) that represents current fuel
- There's a function (capacity ?a - aircraft) that represents maximum fuel capacity

The constraint should be:
- For all aircraft a, always (fuel a) >= (capacity a)/2

In PDDL3.0, this would be expressed as:
(always (forall (?a - aircraft) (>= (fuel ?a) (/ (capacity ?a) 2))))

Let me double-check this:
- "always" is the temporal operator for "at all times"
- "forall (?a - aircraft)" quantifies over all aircraft
- ">= (fuel ?a) (/ (capacity ?a) 2)" expresses that fuel is at least half of capacity

This looks correct for PDDL3.0.

<information>
The user will give as input a constraint in natural language. This constraint must be used as a transjectory hard constraint for the solution plan of the given the PDDL problem. 
</information>

<instructions> 
- Refine the user constraint to make it applicable to the given PDDL problem.
- You can rephrase and decompose the initial constraint into several other contraints.
- These constraints should be complementary and they will be later combined with AND operators.
- Constraints must be state-based and follow a Linear Temporal Logic. So constraints can't directly refer to actions.
- Avoid explicit PDDL language in your answer, the user can't understand PDDL.
- The set of all refined constraints must capture the meaning of the initial user constraint. 
- Format your answer as a clear and concise numbered list between the tags <constraints> and </constraints>. There should be no subitems, only the list of refined constraints.
- After, add 1 or 2 sentences to explain your choice of decomposition between the tags <explanation> and </explanation>.
- Here is an example of how to format your answer:
    <constraints>
        1. [natural_language_constraint_1]
        2. [natural_language_constraint_2]
        ...
    </constraints>
    <explanation>
        [consice_explanation]
    </explanation>
</instructions>

<user_input>
Planes should never have less than half of their maximum fuel capacity
</user_input>

Let me analyze the user constraint and the PDDL problem to understand how to refine it.

The user constraint is: "Planes should never have less than half of their maximum fuel capacity"

Looking at the PDDL domain and problem:
- There are 3 planes: plane1, plane2, plane3
- Each plane has a capacity and current fuel level
- From the problem:
  - plane1: capacity = 2326, initial fuel = 205
  - plane2: capacity = 12132, initial fuel = 1469  
  - plane3: capacity = 5204, initial fuel = 1532

The constraint means that throughout the entire plan execution, each plane's fuel should never drop below half of its maximum capacity.

So for each plane:
- plane1: fuel should never be < 2326/2 = 1163
- plane2: fuel should never be < 12132/2 = 6066
- plane3: fuel should never be < 5204/2 = 2602

Wait, looking at the initial state:
- plane1 has fuel 205, but half capacity is 1163 - so this constraint is already violated initially!
- plane2 has fuel 1469, but half capacity is 6066 - also violated initially!
- plane3 has fuel 1532, but half capacity is 2602 - also violated initially!

Hmm, this suggests that maybe the constraint should be interpreted differently, or maybe the planes need to refuel first before doing anything else.

Actually, let me think about this more carefully. The constraint is a trajectory constraint, meaning it applies throughout the execution of the plan. If the initial state already violates it, then the constraint cannot be satisfied unless we interpret it as "from now on" or allow for an initial refueling phase.

Let me assume the constraint should apply throughout the plan execution, meaning planes should maintain at least half their fuel capacity at all times during plan execution.


I'll translate the constraint into a state-based logical requirement focusing on fuel preservation across all aircraft operations. Each vehicle must consistently retain a minimum fuel threshold, specifically half of its total fuel capacity. This means continuous monitoring of fuel levels to ensure they never drop below the critical midpoint, which would compromise the aircraft's operational capabilities and mission effectiveness.

The key challenge is establishing a dynamic constraint that tracks fuel levels throughout the entire mission sequence, preventing any point where an aircraft's fuel falls below the critical half-capacity mark.

<constraints>
1. Every aircraft should always maintain at least half of its maximum fuel capacity throughout the entire plan execution.
</constraints>

<explanation>
The original constraint applies to all planes universally, so I maintained it as a single comprehensive constraint that covers all aircraft in the problem. This ensures that at no point during the plan execution will any plane's fuel level drop below 50% of its maximum capacity.
</explanation>
